author: The Buddha
content: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.

author: Samuel Johnson
content: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.

author: Heraclitus
content: There is nothing permanent except change.

author: Christopher Morley
content: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.

author: Winston Churchill
content: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.

author: Michael Jordan
content: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.

author: William Ellery Channing
content: Error is discipline through which we advance.

author: Pema Chödrön
content: It isn't what happens to us that causes us to suffer; it's what we say to ourselves about what happens.

author: Aristotle
content: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.

author: The Buddha
content: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.

author: The Buddha
content: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.

author: Napoleon
content: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.

author: Wayne Dyer
content: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.

author: Iris Murdoch
content: We can only learn to love by loving.

author: Richard Bach
content: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back, they're yours; if they don't, they never were.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
content: Do one thing every day that scares you.

author: Carl Jung
content: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams, who looks inside, awakes.

author: Jonas Salk
content: Intuition will tell the thinking mind where to look next.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: It is only when the mind and character slumber that the dress can be seen.

author: Blaise Pascal
content: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not of.

author: Benjamin Franklin
content: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.

author: Aeschylus
content: He who learns must suffer. And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.

author: Amy Tan
content: I am like a falling star who has finally found her place next to another in a lovely constellation, where we will sparkle in the heavens forever.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
content: Imagination is the living power and prime agent of all human perception.

author: William Shakespeare
content: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.

author: Fawn M. Brodie
content: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.

author: Mother Teresa
content: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.

author: Robert Southey
content: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.

author: Alan Watts
content: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.

author: Plato
content: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
content: The beginning is always today.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
content: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.

author: Loretta Young
content: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.

author: Jim Morrison
content: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.

author: Pablo Picasso
content: He can who thinks he can, and he can't who thinks he can't. This is an inexorable, indisputable law.

author: Albert Einstein
content: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.

author: Thomas J. Watson
content: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.

author: Doug Horton
content: Be your own hero, it's cheaper than a movie ticket.

author: Thomas Jefferson
content: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.

author: Hannah More
content: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.

author: Benjamin Spock
content: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.

author: Laurie Anderson
content: Technology is the campfire around which we tell our stories.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Everything in the universe goes by indirection. There are no straight lines.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
content: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.

author: Laozi
content: To see things in the seed, that is genius.

author: Daniel Webster
content: Wisdom begins at the end.

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
content: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.

author: Joyce Meyer
content: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.

author: Andy Warhol
content: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
content: The beginning is always today.

author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
content: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius.

author: Cheng Yen
content: Happiness does not come from having much, but from being attached to little.

author: Ian Botham
content: To me, it doesn't matter how good you are. Sport is all about playing and competing. Whatever you do in cricket and in sport, enjoy it, be positive and try to win.

author: Pema Chödrön
content: The truth you believe and cling to makes you unavailable to hear anything new.

author: Thích Nhất Hạnh
content: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.

author: Confucius
content: Study the past, if you would divine the future.

author: Albert Einstein
content: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.

author: Mary Kay Ash
content: Aerodynamically the bumblebee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumblebee doesn't know that, so it goes on flying anyway.

author: Charlotte Brontë
content: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.

author: John Locke
content: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.

author: Margaret Fuller
content: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.

author: Warren Buffett
content: I won't close down a business of subnormal profitability merely to add a fraction of a point to our corporate returns. I also feel it inappropriate for even an exceptionally profitable company to fund an operation once it appears to have unending losses in prospect. Adam Smith would disagree with my first proposition and Karl Marx would disagree with my second; the middle ground is the only position that leaves me comfortable.

author: Napoleon Hill
content: You might well remember that nothing can bring you success but yourself.

author: Winston Churchill
content: History is written by the victors.

author: Woody Allen
content: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
content: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.

author: Napoleon Hill
content: You might well remember that nothing can bring you success but yourself.

author: George Foreman
content: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.

author: Hanya Yanagihara
content: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: To be great is to be misunderstood.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
content: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Thomas Carlyle
content: By nature, man hates change; seldom will he quit his old home till it has actually fallen around his ears.

author: William Butler Yeats
content: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.

author: Tom Hodgkinson
content: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.

author: Albert Einstein
content: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.

author: George Orwell
content: Myths which are believed in tend to become true.

author: Robert Fulghum
content: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.

author: Maya Angelou
content: We may encounter many defeats, but we must not be defeated.

author: Samuel Richardson
content: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.

author: Albert Einstein
content: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.

author: Tony Blair
content: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.

author: Albert Schweitzer
content: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.

author: Arthur Rubinstein
content: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.

author: Galileo Galilei
content: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.

author: G. K. Chesterton
content: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.

author: Kahlil Gibran
content: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.

author: Francis of Assisi
content: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.

author: Pablo Picasso
content: Action is the foundational key to all success.

author: Albert Schweitzer
content: An optimist is a person who sees a green light everywhere, while the pessimist sees only the red spotlight... The truly wise person is color-blind.

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
content: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Everything that happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.

author: Barack Obama
content: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

author: Lucretius
content: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.

author: Alan Watts
content: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.

author: Francis Bacon
content: It is impossible to love and to be wise.

author: Barack Obama
content: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.

author: Casey Stengel
content: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.

author: Wayne Dyer
content: What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds.
